revised_title: Magnetic Properties of Supraconductors: Exploring the "Freezing In" Effect
tldr: This article investigates the magnetic properties of supraconductors and the "freezing in" effect, where a portion of the magnetic flux remains in the specimen when it returns to the supraconducting state. The authors find that the proportion of "frozen in" flux varies among different metals and alloys, and suggest that inhomogeneities in composition may be the cause of this effect.
